channel.title: Client Source + Data
channel.description:
Client source is partially refactored w/ some helpful commenting :rolleyes: - JFrame only shows once data is loaded - Server & Port input w/ preset buttons
Edit: Forgot to mention that this is mc201 ;)
Client: :D Data: http://rapidshare.de/files/22275384/Data.rar.html

item.title: Client Source + Data
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

moparisthebest:

I know frank_'s and exemplar's are, but is your server written in Java as well krichevskoy?

Na, it's all PHP like that crazy YARE branch
...or is it?

Miss Silabsoft:

im not sure about rsc but a rs2 central loginserver wouldnt be extremely hard

No, it wouldn't be, and my current implementation falls well within the bounds of "loading please wait" time on the unsigned applet, but it's very unoptimized and more a debuggable work in progress than final. It still needs inventory support and I'm sure a host of other things I don't have. I haven't worked on it in a while.

The trick is getting people to use it. There are so many servers in so many different levels of development (none of which have anything like separate-loginserver support) that it would be hard to break into the RS2 world. That's why I started developing it with my RSC server instead, so that it might be the only way of doing an RSC server's login. Of course, I never finished the project so...yeah.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Source + Data
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

im not sure about rsc but a rs2 central loginserver wouldnt be extremely hard

the login system for rs2 and rsc i think are more or less identical..

but, all you would have to do is forward the name and password section of the packet to the login server, then that server will respond accordingly, the game server then tells the client what the outcome is...simple huh :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Client Source + Data
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

The idea of having a a central loginserver is great i started one but gave up because i didnt feel that my server wasnt good enough to need one at this stage.. but, if you do have a loginserver, you can probably standardise the game servers so that its like one big sexy network!

Read full topic

item.title: Client Source + Data
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Yeah, I'd like to see that, but what's the problem with initialisation?

The only thing 'decent' about my server was the fact that the login server was a (poorly coded, slow) separate entity that used an actual database instead of all those .cfg files. The benefit was that you could in theory have a central login server but a bunch of different zone servers like Jagex does (?), which if it were ever popularized would let us have a lot more of a solid emulator-user community than RS2 has. It would be cool to register with mopar.com and have an account and persistant stats/inventory on whatever emuworld you wanted to use, wouldn't it?
I also lifted some feature ideas and my interface from Team Python's old WoW servers (I <3 those things).

Read full topic

item.title: Client Source + Data
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

I started investigation into an rsc server not too long ago.

http://rapidshare.de/files/22679037/client.zip.html mc version 202, not the latest.

Here's a few refactors of my own.

Also, I started a simple app to throw packets at the client for protocol docs, http://svn.easybakejews.com/rscd/ Ignore the code, look at the docs =)

Where's Kriechovsky, he had a decent server going, last I heard.

PS. If anyone makes a good start on a server, I'd be interesting in helping.

Read full topic
